Dear Mack McGhee:
Attached is an amended Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility.
Due to the violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required.
The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact area manager, Rorie Dodge-Pifer, at 517-899-6024.
Sincerely,
Vivian Malleck, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 9/15/24, a staff member completed an improper restraint on a
youth. The staff member grabbed the youth around the neck in a
choking manner and was kneeling on the thigh area while the
youth was on the ground.
Investigation Interviews
Complainant was interviewed on 09/26/2024. Complainant did
not have additional information.
Youth A was interviewed on 09/26/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention with another Department of Health and Human
Service worker. Youth A stated he was not interested in being
interviewed about the incident between him and Staff 1. Youth A
was not observed with any marks or injuries. Another attempt to
interview Youth A was tried on 10/10/2024. Youth A stated he
already spoke to a Special Investigation Unit Investigator (Wayne
County Juvenile Detention employee) and did not want to
rediscuss the incident between him and Staff 1. Before concluding
his interview, Youth A stated he spit on Staff 1. Youth A also
stated he was not injured in this incident.
Youth B was interviewed on 10/30/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention with another DHHS worker. Youth B stated he
saw the incident between Youth A and Staff 1 from his Unit 3B
room (Room 16). Youth B stated Youth A kicked Staff 1’s legs and
pulled himself towards the ground while Staff 1 and Supervisor
Trainee escorted Youth A to his room. Youth B stated Youth A
spit, bit, and threatened to kill Staff 1 when Staff 1 was on the
ground with Youth A. Youth B stated Youth A was on the ground
on his side and stomach as Staff 1 held Youth A’s hands behind
2

his back. Youth A stated Supervisor Trainee was present, but did
not physically manage Youth A.
Staff 1 was interviewed on 10/02/2024 at Wayne County Juvenile
Detention with another DHHS worker. Staff 1 stated he was the
only staff working Unit 3B when several youths refused to enter
their rooms for bed on 09/15/2024. Staff 1 stated Supervisor 1,
Supervisor 2 and Supervisor Trainee responded around 9:45 PM
when he called for assistance. Staff 1 stated as Staff 1 opened the
youth room doors Youth A closed youth room doors preventing
youths from entering their rooms for the night. Staff 1 stated
Supervisor Trainee gave him a nod indicating they would escort
Youth A to his room. Staff 1 stated he took hold of Youth A's right
arm and Supervisor Trainee took hold of Youth A’s left arm. Staff
1 stated Youth A struggled and kicked backwards and connected
with Staff 1’s left leg. Staff 1 stated in an “unorthodox” move, he
reached around Youth A’s chest and took Youth A to the ground
on his side. Staff 1 stated his knees were on the ground as he
held Youth A down and asked why he was kicked. Staff 1 stated
Supervisor Trainee directed Staff 1 to get up as Youth A swung,
kicked, cursed and bit Staff 1’s left wrist. Staff 1 stated he got up
and refused Supervisor 2’s directives to back up. Staff 1 stated he
“lunged”, grabbed and ripped Youth A’s shirt after Youth A spit at
him three times. Staff 1 stated Supervisor 1 and Supervisor
Trainee escorted Youth A to his room. Staff 1 stated Supervisor 2
discussed the incident with him afterwards and he understood that
he should have left the area to allow for Youth A’s de-escalation.
Staff 1 stated he finished working his shift on Unit 3B. Staff 1
stated he regrets his actions with Youth A and contributes his
reaction to the pain in his left knee after being kicked, which he
had surgery on in 2023, and working long hours without adequate
breaks. Staff 1 denied choking or placing his knee on Youth A
during this incident. Staff 1 was observed with a healing scratch
on his left jawline and teeth marks on his left wrist.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed on 10/02/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention with another DHHS worker. Supervisor 1
stated he responded to an assistance call on Unit 3B with
Supervisor 2 and Supervisor Trainee sometime after 9:00 PM on
09/15/2024. Supervisor 1 stated he heard a commotion on the
other side of the unit and Supervisor Trainee calling him when he
assisted in escorting youths to their rooms. Supervisor 1 stated he
walked towards the staff desk and saw Staff 1 on the ground with
Youth A, who was lying on his back, and Supervisor Trainee
standing next to them. Supervisor 1 stated he and Supervisor
Trainee directed Staff 1 and Youth A to disengage and get up.
3

Once Youth A and Staff 1 stood up, Supervisor 1 stated he faced
Youth A and wrapped his arms around Youth A from the side to
prevent Youth A from hitting Staff 1 and redirected Youth A to
calm down. Supervisor 1 stated Youth A spit several times at Staff
1 and threatened to kill Staff 1. Supervisor 1 stated Staff 1 stood
two to three arms-length behind Supervisor 1 and Supervisor
Trainee and did not say anything back to Youth A but refused
redirection to move away. Supervisor 1 stated Staff 1 stepped
towards Youth A and placed his hands on Youth A’s upper arms.
Supervisor 1 stated he and Supervisor Trainee escorted Youth A
to his room. Supervisor 1 stated it was a tense situation, but he
did not witness or suspect Staff 1 abused Youth A.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed on 10/02/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention with another DHHS worker. Supervisor 2
stated she responded to an assistance call on Unit 3B with
Supervisor 1 and Supervisor Trainee about youths refusing to go
to bed. Supervisor 2 stated she assisted by redirecting and
escorting youths to their rooms. Supervisor 2 stated she and
Supervisor 1 heard a commotion and Staff 1 requesting
assistance. Supervisor 2 stated Supervisor 1 went to assist while
she continued to close youth room doors. Supervisor 2 stated
when she walked over to the staff desk, she saw Youth A on the
ground with Staff 1 “hunched” over him and Supervisor Trainee
standing next to them. Supervisor 2 stated Supervisor 1 and
Supervisor Trainee directed Staff 1 to get up from the ground.
Supervisor 2 stated once Youth A and Staff 1 stood up,
Supervisor 1 stood between them to prevent Youth A's swings
from contacting Staff 1. Supervisor 2 stated she motioned and
redirected Staff 1 to back away, but he did not respond and
remained focused on Youth A. Supervisor 2 stated Youth A
threatened to kill Staff 1 and Staff 1 told Youth A to do it.
Supervisor 2 stated she left to open Youth A’s room door and
Supervisor 1 and Supervisor Trainee escorted Youth A to his
room. Supervisor 2 stated she spoke with Staff 1 after the incident
and told him that he should have moved away when directed to
assist in de-escalating the situation. Supervisor 2 stated Staff 1
told her that Youth A hit him, but she did not witness it. Supervisor
2 stated she did not witness or suspect Staff 1 abused Youth A.
Supervisor Trainee was interviewed on 10/02/2024 at Wayne
County Juvenile Detention with another DHHS worker. Supervisor
Trainee stated he responded to an assistance call on Unit 3B
about youths refusing to enter their room for bed. Supervisor
Trainee stated Youth A and Staff 1 argued back and forth (does
not recall the dialogue) and he directed Staff 1 to assist him in
4

escorting Youth A to his room. Supervisor Trainee stated Staff 1
and Youth A went to the ground during the escort and Supervisor
Trainee immediately released Youth A. Supervisor Trainee stated
he tapped Staff 1 on the back several times to let go of Youth A
and get up, but Youth A held onto Staff 1’s shirt preventing Staff 1
from moving away from Youth A. Supervisor Trainee stated he
called for Supervisor 1 to assist. Supervisor Trainee stated Staff 1
and Youth A got up from the ground and Youth A began to spit at
Staff 1. Supervisor Trainee stated he and Supervisor 1 escorted
Youth A to his room. Supervisor Trainee stated he did not witness
or suspect Staff 1 abused Youth A.
Manager was interviewed on 09/26/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention with another DHHS worker. Manager stated
Staff 1 is removed from the schedule pending investigation
outcome.
Video
09/15/2024 Unit 3B video footage shows Youth A walking
between Staff 1 and Supervisor Trainee with his left arm held by
Supervisor Trainee and his right arm held by Staff 1. Youth A
kicks his right foot back and it connects with Staff 1’s lower left
leg. Staff 1 places his arm with his elbow in front of Youth A’s neck
and Supervisor Trainee lets go of Youth A. Staff 1 forces Youth A
to the ground on to his bottom and then to his back. Staff 1’s
hands are on Youth A’s upper shoulders near his collar bone.
Staff 1 and Youth A maneuver to a corner adjacent to the staff
desk as Supervisor Trainee attempts to intervene. Video footage
does not capture Youth A’s actions or reactions in the corner as
Staff 1 hovers over and struggles with Youth A. Staff 1’s knees are
not seen on Youth A’s thighs. Supervisor Trainee stands next to
the corner with his back to the video camera and his hands are
either on Staff 1 or between Staff 1 and Youth A in attempt to
disengage Staff 1 and Youth A. Supervisor 1 walks to the staff
desk area and Staff 1 releases his hold of Youth A and stands up.
Youth A jumps up, moves towards and spits on Staff 1. Supervisor
1 secures his arms around Youth A’s upper chest and shoulders
to prevent Youth A from moving towards Staff 1 with the
assistance of Supervisor Trainee. Youth A spits at Staff 1.
Supervisor 2 walks to the staff desk area. Staff 1 reaches between
Supervisor 1 and Supervisor Trainee and pulls on Youth A’s shirt.
Supervisor 1, Supervisor Trainee and Youth A move towards Staff
1’s pull. Youth A’s shirt is vertically torn more than halfway in the
back. Supervisor 2 walks to open Youth A’s room door. Supervisor
1 and Supervisor Trainee escort Youth A to his room. Video
footage does not have audio.
5

Documentation
Youth A’s nursing progress note dated 09/16/2024 at 12:30 AM
states Youth A was not observed with bruising, marks or
discoloration. Youth A denied pain and injury.
Supervisor 1 wrote an incident report on 09/24/2024 that is
predominantly consistent with his interview. The following
information from the incident report was not stated in his interview.
Supervisor 1 wrote Staff 1 reached between Supervisor 1 and
Supervisor Trainee and grabbed and ripped Youth A’s shirt.
Supervisor 2 and Supervisor Trainee wrote incident reports on
09/24/2024 that are consistent with their interviews.
Staff 1 completed Handle with Care training on 03/28/2024. Staff 1
does not have a history of discipline.
Supervisor 1 completed Handle with Care training on 11/30/2024.
Supervisor 1 does not have a history of discipline.
Supervisor Trainee completed Handle with Care training on
04/24/2024. Supervisor Trainee does not have a history of
discipline.
Analysis The agency is found in noncompliance when Staff 1 secured his
elbow in front of Youth A’s neck and forcefully pushed Youth A to
the ground. It cannot be determined without Youth A’s interview if
Staff 1 placed his hands on Youth A’s neck, but video review
suggests Staff 1’s hands were near Youth A’s collarbone when
they went to the ground. Based on video footage captured, it does
not show Staff 1 placed his knee on Youth A’s thigh and none of
the interviews stated this occurred. Noncompliance is also found
when Staff 1 grabbed Youth A’s shirt and forcefully ripped it.
Conclusion REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
2024SIC0001771 Corrective action plan pending

Rule Code Program statement.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care, safety,
and supervision methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans and discharge of residents.
Violation Additional Finding
Type
Investigation Interviews
Staff 1 was interviewed on 10/02/2024 at Wayne County Juvenile
Detention with another DHHS worker. Staff 1 stated he
documented the 09/15/2024 incident with Youth A in Unit 3B’s
logbook. Staff 1 stated he did not write an incident report because
he worked 17 hours on 09/15/2024 and left when he was relieved
of this mandated overtime shift.
Documentation
Supervisor 1, Supervisor 2 and Supervisor Trainee did not write
an incident report on 09/15/2024 about Youth A and Staff 1 but
completed one on 09/24/2024. Another DHHS worker spoke with
Special Investigation Unit Investigator and determined Supervisor
1, Supervisor 2 and Supervisor Trainee were directed to write
incident reports when none were found by Special Investigation
Unit Investigator.
Staff 1’s 09/15/2024 logbook documentation of the incident with
Youth A was unavailable for review. Deputy Director stated Unit
3B’s logbook was destroyed by a youth on 09/16/2024.
Wayne County Juvenile Detention Incident Report Rationale
policy and procedure 6.1 states incident reports are to be entered
in the system before the end of the shift that the incident occurred.
It also states a supervisor ensures the incident report is written
and entered into the system.
Analysis The agency is found in noncompliance of Staff 1, Supervisor 1,
Supervisor 2 and Supervisor Trainee not writing an incident report
before the end of their shift on 09/15/2024 regarding the incident
between Staff 1 and Youth A.
Conclusion REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
2024SIC0001771 Corrective action plan pending
7

Rule Code Staff to resident ratio.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4127
Section (1) The licensee shall develop and adhere to a written staff to
Description resident ratio formula for direct care workers.
Violation Additional Finding
Type
Investigation Interviews
Staff 1 was interviewed on 10/02/2024 at Wayne County Juvenile
Detention with another DHHS worker. Staff 1 stated he worked
Unit 1B from 7:00 AM to 3:00 PM on 09/15/2024 and did not
receive a lunch break. Staff 1 stated he was mandated to work
overtime on Unit 3B from 3:00 PM to 11:00 PM on 09/15/2024 and
received a lunch break at 8:00 PM. Staff 1 stated he was the only
staff on Unit 3B and the unit was not in compliance with staff to
youth ratio during his 3:00 PM to 11:00 PM shift. Staff 1 stated he
was unsure, but believed he worked alone with 13 or 14 youths on
Unit 3B from 3:00 PM to 11:00 PM.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed on 10/02/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention with another DHHS worker. Supervisor 2
stated Staff 1 worked Unit 3B by himself on 09/15/2024 from 3:00
PM to 11:00 PM. Supervisor 2 stated Unit 3B may have been out
of staff to youth ratio when asked if staff to youth ratio was met.
Supervisor 2 stated she did not know the exact number of youths
on the unit on 09/15/2024 from 3:00 PM to 11:00 PM.
Deputy Director was interviewed on 10/10/2024 at Wayne
County Juvenile Detention. Deputy Director stated staff to resident
ratio is 1:8 during waking hours.
Documentation
09/15/2024 Unit 3B roster lists 12 youths on the unit.
Wayne County Juvenile Detention Pod Staffing and Management
– 10.10 policy and procedure received on 09/24/2024 does not
state the correct staff to resident ratio as previously reviewed and
approved by Department of Child Welfare Licensing and as stated
by Deputy Director.
Wayne County Juvenile Detention provided Staff 1’s work and
break schedule from 09/10/2024 to 09/16/2024.
• 09/10/2024 Staff 1’s scheduled off day. He did not work.
8

• 09/11/2024 Staff 1’s scheduled off day. He did not work.
• 09/12/2024 Staff 1 worked morning shift and his lunch
break is not documented. Staff 1 worked mandated
afternoon shift and his lunch break is not documented.
• 09/13/2024 Staff 1 worked morning shift and his lunch
break is documented as 8:30 AM to 9:15 AM. Staff 1
worked mandated afternoon shift and his lunch break is not
documented.
• 09/14/2024 Staff 1’s approved leave day. He did not work.
• 09/15/2024 Staff 1 worked morning shift and his lunch
break is not documented. Staff 1 worked mandated
afternoon shift and his lunch break is not documented.
• 09/16/2024 Staff 1 called in for his shift. He did not work.
Analysis The agency is found in noncompliance of maintaining staff to
youth ratio on Unit 3B from 3:00 PM to 11:00 PM on 09/15/2024.
Staff 1 worked Unit 3B by himself with 12 youths.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
Revise staff to resident ratio in Pod Staffing and Management –
10.10 policy and procedure and submit to Division of Child
Welfare Licensing. Also, review issue date, effective date, and
amendment date of this policy and procedure and revise
accordingly. If an incorrect copy of this policy and procedure was
sent, please forward the correct version.
Supervisors, managers and directors (if trained in restraint) are
able to provide emergency staff coverage for youth supervision
and count in the staff to youth ratio for compliance. The name of
the supervisor, manager or director is to be documented on the
Daily Assignment Sheet when this emergency coverage occurs for
verification purposes.
CONSULTATION
It cannot be conclusively determined if Staff 1’s breaks were not
received or taken and not documented. It may be prudent to
document staff breaks in the shift supervisor summary report in
addition to break sign in sheets and unit logbook.
Continue to assess staffing needs to decrease mandating staff to
work additional shifts.
Conclusion REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
2024SIC0001736 Corrective action plan pending

As a result of the findings in this investigation, a corrective action plan is required.
